p: Such a difference in city groups’ energy intensity is determined by the cities’ economic structures. The energy production and heavy manufacturing cities have more energy-insensitive sectors, which emit high CO 2 with low economic outputs. Conversely, high-tech and service-based cities rely more on the high-tech industries and service sectors. This led them to lower emission intensities. Figure 3 (B to F) shows the economic structures of the five city groups.
